Some examples of improper adoption agency practices include fraud, manipulation or coercion of birth parents, lack of transparency in fees and expenses, poor record-keeping, insufficient training and support for adoptive families, and failure to follow up on post-adoption support. In some instances, these practices have led to failed adoptions, legal challenges, and significant emotional trauma for all parties involved. 

It is important for adoptive families and birth parents to carefully research and select reputable adoption agencies, and to be fully informed of the agency's policies, practices, and reputation before entering into an adoption agreement. This can help to ensure that the adoption process is conducted in a legal, ethical, and professional manner, and that the best interests of the children and families involved are protected.
